alert.note: Alert for Northwest Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 5:44PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Aroostook County through 645 PM EDT... At 544 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles west of Fish River Lake, or 12 miles southwest of Deboullie Mountain, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eagle Lake, Deboullie Mountain, Fish River Lake, Allagash Township, Winterville, Saint Francis and Saint John. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
